intro: Selliera microphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved selliera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tubular, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, showcasing its adaptability to diverse environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
